instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.BUTTON_DISABLE: What is BUTTON_DISABLE? BUTTON_DISABLE disables the trackpad when SMC_LID is below 0.5v and the system believes the lid is closed. .

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
Hello,
I have a Macbook <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with no trackpad. I replaced the cable and the trackpad as well from a donor laptop but its still the same. Can this be a board issue ? The board is clean though.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
Check L4807 and <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR>.
Bypass them for test...

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message: What do you mean by bypass them ? Should we remove them ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
Ran a jumper wire from Point 2 of L4807 to Point 2 of <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR>.

The device didnt turn on. Only Backlight was there.
Removed the jumper . The device turned on.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
What???
I said to bypass 2 components; not to tied them together.
Didn't think that shouldn't join 3V3 and 5V power rails???

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message: Sorry but i have not understood what you mean bypass. Should we remove the component and run a wire from point 1 to point 2 ?

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message: No need to remove them, once you run the wire over.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
So, you have correct voltage at pins 1 & 4 of J4800?

Check traces between J4800 and <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>.
Also resolder them.
Keyboard works correctly?
Do you have 0V at <SIGNAL>BUTTON_DISABLE</SIGNAL>?
Be sure <RESISTOR>R4800</RESISTOR> is good.

If still not working, replace <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
Correct Voltages at Pin 1 and Pin 2.

Keyboard Works correctly.

Yes 0V at Button Disable.

<RESISTOR>R4800</RESISTOR> Voltage Cycling between 1.4 to 3.2V continuously.\

Note - All above voltages are taken with the bypass done on L4807 and <RESISTOR>R4808</RESISTOR>.

What do you mean by check traces ? i didnt understand that

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message:
Check traces continuity between trackpad connector (J4800) and <CHIP>U4801</CHIP>.

I recommend to try more trackpad cables.
2 from 3 (new chinese) cables failed for me time ago.

threads.title: Macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> - <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Trackpad Not Working
threads.message: Customer didnt give me time was in a hurry. Hence returned.
